headline.main: Militants Claim Attack on NPDC Oil Pipeline in Niger Delta
headline.print_headline: Militants Claim Attack on NPDC Oil Pipeline in Niger Delta

docs.snippet: Militants have blown up a crude oil pipeline operated by Nigeria's state oil firm NNPC in the Niger Delta, a group claiming responsibility for the attack and a youth leader said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Militants have blown up a crude oil pipeline operated by Nigeria's state oil firm NNPC in the Niger Delta, a group claiming responsibility for the attack and a youth leader said on Monday.

headline.main: London Fashion Week Hits Climax With Burberry, Erd
headline.print_headline: London Fashion Week Hits Climax With Burberry, Erd

docs.snippet: Luxury British fashion house Burberry unveiled its highly anticipated display at London Fashion Week Monday, an opulent affair featuring frilly blouses, velvet blazers and silky pajama shirts - for both men and women. Elsewhere, Christopher Kane a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Luxury British fashion house Burberry unveiled its highly anticipated display at London Fashion Week Monday, an opulent affair featuring frilly blouses, velvet blazers and silky pajama shirts - for both men and women. Elsewhere, Christopher Kane and Erdem were among designers showing off their newest collections to the fashion pack before they jet off to Milan.

headline.main: Syrian or Russian Warplanes Bomb Aleppo, Casualities Reported - Monitor
headline.print_headline: Syrian or Russian Warplanes Bomb Aleppo, Casualities Reported - Monitor

docs.snippet: Syrian or Russian warplanes bombed the city of Aleppo and nearby villages on Monday, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported, after the Syrian military said a seven-day ceasefire was over....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian or Russian warplanes bombed the city of Aleppo and nearby villages on Monday, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported, after the Syrian military said a seven-day ceasefire was over.

headline.main: Plea Talks Under Way in FIFA Bribery Case as U.S. Trial Date Set
headline.print_headline: Plea Talks Under Way in FIFA Bribery Case as U.S. Trial Date Set

docs.snippet: Several defendants charged in a wide-ranging corruption case involving soccer's global governing body FIFA are in talks with U.S. officials about possibly pleading guilty, a U.S. prosecutor said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Several defendants charged in a wide-ranging corruption case involving soccer's global governing body FIFA are in talks with U.S. officials about possibly pleading guilty, a U.S. prosecutor said on Monday.

headline.main: Obama on Weekend Bombings and Attacks

docs.snippet: President Obama made his first public comments after bombings in New York City and New Jersey and addressed stabbings in Minnesota, for which ISIS has claimed responsibility....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama made his first public comments after bombings in New York City and New Jersey and addressed stabbings in Minnesota, for which ISIS has claimed responsibility.

headline.main: 'Lucky' to Be Alive: Calf With 2 Faces Born at Kentucky Farm

headline.main: Turkey: Man Jailed for Attacking Woman in Shorts
headline.print_headline: Turkey: Man Jailed for Attacking Woman in Shorts

docs.snippet: Turkey's state-run news agency says a court has ordered a man arrested pending trial for attacking a woman who was wearing shorts on a bus, after his initial release from custody caused uproar....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey's state-run news agency says a court has ordered a man arrested pending trial for attacking a woman who was wearing shorts on a bus, after his initial release from custody caused uproar.

headline.main: France Says Libya Needs Compromise to Avoid Sliding Backwards
headline.print_headline: France Says Libya Needs Compromise to Avoid Sliding Backwards

docs.snippet: France warned on Monday that an offensive by forces loyal to eastern Libyan commander Khalifa Haftar on oil facilities risked plunging the country backwards and urged the national unity government to be more inclusive to break a political deadlock...
docs.lead_paragraph: France warned on Monday that an offensive by forces loyal to eastern Libyan commander Khalifa Haftar on oil facilities risked plunging the country backwards and urged the national unity government to be more inclusive to break a political deadlock.
